statement:
**Proposition.** If $R$ is a principal ideal domain, then $R$ is a
unique factorization domain.

*Proof.* Recall, that due to Kaplansky Theorem (see for details) it is
enough to show that every nonzero prime ideal in $R$ contains a prime
element.

On the other hand, recall that an element $p\in R$ is prime if and only
if an ideal $(p)$ generated by $p$ is nonzero and prime.

Thus, if $P$ is a nonzero prime ideal in $R$, then (since $R$ is a PID)
there exists $p\in R$ such that $P=(p)$. This completes the proof.
$\square$
names: every PID is a UFD - alternative proof
